title: Natalie Dormer looks unrecognisable in a 1930's inspired wig on Penny Dreadful: City Of Angels set
text:
In February it was announced that she would be joining the cast of the spin-off to hit series Penny Dreadful.

And Natalie Dormer looked almost unrecognisable as she sported a 1930's inspired vintage wig as she was spotted for the first time on the set of Penny Dreadful: City Of Angels on Thursday.

The actress, 37, also sported a brown woollen waistcoat and a matching skirt as she filmed scenes alongside co-star Michael Gladis.

Who's that girl: Natalie Dormer looked almost unrecognisable as she sported a 1930's inspired vintage wig as she was spotted for the first time on the set of Penny Dreadful: City Of Angels

Completing her costume, Natalie also donned a crisp white shirt and a large, brown leather handbag.

Adding a touch of comfort in between scenes, the Game Of Thrones star also rocked a pair of black Ugg boots, of which she'll presumably remove once the cameras begin rolling.

Natalie appeared in good spirits as she rocked the curly, brunette headpiece and made her way across the set of the new series, which is set in Los Angeles in 1938.

Natalie will take on the role of Magda, who is described as 'a supernatural demon who can take the appearance of anyone she chooses and manifests in a number of guises throughout the story.

In character: The actress, 37, also sported a brown woollen waistcoat and a matching skirt as she filmed scenes alongside co-star Michael Gladis on Thursday

'Charismatic, clever and chameleonic, Magda is a dangerous enemy and an invaluable ally.'

The actress joins other previously announced cast members including Daniel Zovatto, Jessica Garza and Jonathan Nieves.

Penny Dreadful: City Of Angels is outlined as a spiritual descendant of the original series which was set in Victorian London.

It opens with a grisly murder which sees Detective Tiago Vega (Zovatto) embroiled in an extraordinary story reflects the rich history of LA, from the building of the city’s first freeways and its deep traditions of Mexican-American folklore, to the dangerous espionage actions of the Third Reich and the rise of radio evangelism.

On set: Natalie (with co-star Michael Gladis) appeared in good spirits as she made her way across the set of the new series, which is set in Los Angeles in 1938

Role: Natalie will take on the role of Magda, who is described as 'a supernatural demon who can take the appearance of anyone she chooses and manifests in a number of guises

According to Showtime's 2018 announcement, the new series will be 'rooted in the conflict between characters connected to the deity Santa Muerte and others allied with the Devil.'

Though it isn't clear what kind relationship the new series will have with the one that ended three years ago there will be at least one common thread.

John Logan - who created, wrote, and executive produced Penny Dreadful - will returning to the fantasy drama.

The 58-year-old three-time Oscar nominee said in the statement: 'PENNY DREADFUL: CITY OF ANGELS will have a social consciousness and historical awareness that we chose not to explore in the PENNY DREADFUL London storylines.'

New: According to Showtime's 2018 announcement, the new series will be 'rooted in the conflict between characters connected to the deity Santa Muerte and others allied with the Devil'

He goes on to say that the upcoming series will be grappling with real-world historical, political, religious, social and racial issues.

'There are no easy answers. There are only powerful questions and arresting moral challenges.'

'As always in the world of PENNY DREADFUL, there are no heroes or villains in this world, only protagonists and antagonists; complicated and conflicted characters living on the fulcrum of moral choice.'

The original Penny Dreadful series aired over three seasons from 2014 to 2016.

It starred Josh Hartnett, Eva Greene, Patti LuPone, Reeve Carney, and Timothy Dalton and was received well critically.
